comments:
When I try to open a report design that was created with BIRT 2.1.2 with the new 2.2 version, I get the following exception :

Can you attach the report file? This may relate to particular report design.

Created an attachment (id=73829)
Simple report template used as base for a dynamic template generation
The attached file opens correctly in my machine. Can you constantly recreate this problem? Are all the 2.1.2 files in your machine have this problem?

- Problem is constantly reproductible
- I haven't managed to open a single report created in 2.1.2 with version 2.2
- I run on Windows XP Pro Service Pack 2
- I have a lot of reports (~40) created in 2.1.2, not a single one opens in 2.2
Are you using BIRT2.2-all-in-one package or update from the update site? Note BIRT2.2 requires eclipse3.3 and JDK/JRE1.5.
It happens to me too on both Linux and Windows, when I use File / Open menu item. If I move this report to reporting project and open it via Navigator, no exception occurs.
I forgot to mention that it is not relevant whether the report was created in 2.1.2 or 2.2.0. File / Open is the issue, see bug #182257

If user use "open file.." menu to open the report file, the editor input is FileStoreEditorInput, not IPathEditorInput we currently support. Need investigation for if we can support this kind of input. If we can not support this in this release, at least we should provide a more friendly message instead exception.

The FileStoreEditorInput is introduced in eclipse 3.3.
Add support for it, fixed.
